business.headline: MS Dhoni files for trademark of iconic nickname 'Captain Cool'Over the years, 'Captain Cool' has meant much more than just a catchy title. It sums up Dhoni's calm mind under pressure, from winning India's first T20 World Cup in 2007 to lifting the ODI World Cup in 2011 and the Champions Trophy in 2013.
Sensex ends 450 points lower, Nifty below 25,600; Trent gains 3%The S&P BSE Sensex fell 452.44 points to close at 83,606.46, while the NSE Nifty50 dropped 120.75 points, ending below the 25,600 mark.

Look rich or be rich: Startup founder on middle class dilemmaToday, many people in the middle class are busy trying to look rich, rather than actually becoming rich. Costly gadgets, fancy brunches and trendy holidays are often paid for with loans and EMIs, says founder and CEO, Shyam Achuthan.

8 years of GST: Top 5 achievements you should knowSince its launch, GST has strengthened India's revenue and expanded the taxpayer base, with collections reaching a record Rs 22.08 lakh crore in 2024–25, as per PIB.

IndusInd Bank submits CEO shortlist to RBI after leadership exits: ReportThe candidates include Rajiv Anand, Rahul Shukla, and Anup Saha — all experienced financial sector leaders. The move comes after the abrupt exits of CEO Sumant Kathpalia and deputy Arun Khurana in April, following a $230 million hit from years of misaccounting in internal derivative trades.

Rural India holds steady as urban consumption slows, finds Equirus SecuritiesThe mood remains subdued overall, but analysts note an undercurrent of recovery in rural pockets, led by fast-moving consumer goods (FMCG), electric mobility and segments of real estate.

Filing ITR without a CA? 5 common mistakes that you must avoidMany people mix up the financial year and assessment year. For income earned in 2024-25, the assessment year will be 2025-26. Pick this carefully or your return will not be valid.

Terms agreed and locked, India-US trade deal likely before July 8The much-awaited deal comes just in the nick of time, as Trump's deadline for imposing reciprocal tariffs on countries worldwide ends on July 9. Last week, Trump said his administration was looking to remove all trade barriers, which he called 'unthinkable'.

Government's favourite baby: Investment banker on India's real estate boomInvestment banker Sarthak Ahuja says India's real estate sector isn't in a bubble—it's backed by policy, jobs, and demographics, making it a long-term priority for the government.

Explained: Why JB Chemicals shares plunged over 6% todayThe market reaction came swiftly after Torrent Pharmaceuticals announced it will acquire a controlling 46.39% stake in JB Pharma from global investment firm KKR, with plans to subsequently merge the two companies.
Adani Enterprises to raise Rs 1,000 crore via retail bondsThe proposed bonds have been rated AA- by both ICRA and Care Ratings, signalling a relatively stable credit outlook.

Most corrupt I've seen: Finfluencer on Indian metro real estate marketFinfluencer Akshat Shrivastava is calling metro real estate a "financial ruin," warning middle-class buyers to stop chasing low-yield properties bankrolled by black money and billionaire hoarders.

entertainment.headline: First poster of Christopher Nolan's The Odyssey leaked? Here's what we knowThe first poster of Christopher Nolan's much-awaited film 'The Odyssey' has been leaked online. The film, featuring an ensemble cast, is expected to be released next year.

Karan Johar recalls how a troll's comment on his twins left him heartbrokenKaran Johar revealed the emotional impact of a harsh online comment that made him question his decision to be a single parent. Despite the challenges, he shared that he finds joy and strength in raising his twins with support from his found family.

Naseeruddin Shah backs Diljit, slams political attacks: He had no role in castingVeteran actor Naseeruddin Shah shared a post and backed Diljit Dosanjh amid the 'Sardaar Ji 3' controversy. The actor stated how such acts hamper personal interactions between Indians and Pakistanis.

Kareena calls Saif Iron Man for sons, says she's still coping with knife attackKareena Kapoor opened up about Saif Ali Khan's stabbing incident, sharing that she's still coming to terms with it. She revealed how the attack exposed the harsh realities of the world to their children.

Rashmika Mandanna says she will never smoke on-screen: Will let the film goDuring a recent interview, Rashmika Mandanna opened up about her opinion on smoking on-screen, stating that she would rather walk away from a film than agree to smoke on-screen.

Aamir Khan often drinks with Salman-SRK all night, and they never stop at oneAamir Khan discussed his close friendship with Shah Rukh Khan and Salman Khan, including their late-night gatherings. He shared how his friendships with the two superstars grew over the years.

Same drug, different packaging: Hansal Mehta, KJo review Brad Pitt's F1Filmmakers Karan Johar and Hansal Mehta reviewed Brad Pitt's film 'F1', saying it's full of cliches but still very entertaining. They praised the racing scenes and Brad Pitt's performance, calling the film a fun watch despite its predictable story.

Kannappa leaked online: Vishnu Manchu claims 30,000 pirated links taken downAfter a solid opening weekend at the box office, Vishnu Manchu's 'Kannappa' faced a major setback with widespread piracy leaks. The actor has publicly urged fans to reject pirated versions and support cinema through legal means.

Tanvi The Great trailer: Shubhangi debuts in Anupam Kher's film about hope and gritThe trailer of 'Tanvi The Great' introduces Shubhangi as an autistic girl who dreams of joining the Indian Army. The story explores her inspiring journey of hope, determination, and acceptance amid societal challenges.

Is Silambarasan's 49th film a sequel to Dhanush's Vada Chennai? Vetri Maaran clarifiesSilambarasan's upcoming film 'STR49' is confirmed to be a distinct project set in the same universe as 'Vada Chennai', but not its sequel, according to director Vetri Maaran. He also opened up about his close bond with actor Dhanush.

ATEEZ calls Golden Hour: Part.3 bold and playful, sends love for ATINYsK-pop sensation ATEEZ continues to break new ground with their historic Billboard entry and evolving artistry. Their latest album, GOLDEN HOUR : Part.3, showcases maturity and creativity, while they acknowledge the love they receive from Indian ATINYs. Read the full exclusive interview with ATEEZ.

Charlize Theron roasts Bezos-Sanchez's lavish wedding: They suck and we're coolActor Charlize Theron slammed the guests who attended Jeff Bezos and Lauren Sanchez's wedding. The wedding is estimated to have cost $50 million.

The Batman 2 makers finally finish script, share update on Robert Pattinson's filmThree years after 'The Batman' premiered in cinemas, director Matt Reeves and screenwriter Mattson Tomlin have now officially completed the script. The sequel is one step closer to moving into production.

Shefali Jariwala's death probe: Anti-ageing, skin glow medicines, fasting in focusShefali Jariwala was found dead at her residence on June 27. The police officials collected anti-ageing and skin-glow medicines from her place during their investigation.

Sarzameen teaser: Ibrahim plays terrorist, Prithviraj a soldier in high-stakes dramaPrithviraj Sukumaran, Kajol and Ibrahim Ali Khan's upcoming film 'Sarzameen' is officially announced by JioHoistar. The movie will stream from July 25.

BTS' label HYBE is coming to India: New subsidiary to open in second half of 2025HYBE is setting up a subsidiary in India by 2025 to tap into the country's vibrant music market and digitally savvy youth. This strategic expansion seeks to blend K-pop's global success formula with India's rich cultural diversity, potentially transforming the local music industry.

Deepika Padukone's old interview demanding work-life balance surfaces amid Vanga rowActor Deepika Padukone had been advocating for work-life balance long before she walked out of filmmaker Sandeep Reddy Vanga's upcoming film 'Spirit.' An old interview of the actor has resurfaced, in which she spoke about the importance of fixed working hours for a film's cast and crew.

Forever to go: Kareena Kapoor celebrates 25 years in industry with Refugee postersKareena Kapoor Khan celebrated 25 years in Bollywood, marking a journey of versatility and enduring stardom. She shared nostalgic posters from her debut film 'Refugee' as fans and celebrities joined in the joyous occasion.

Vishnu Manchu admits to poor VFX in Kannappa, reacts to criticismActor Vishnu Manchu recently addressed the criticism over his latest release 'Kannappa'. He talked about the production challenges, and shared that he had to remove a few scenes due to poor VFX.

general news.headline: India's Agni-5 'bunker buster' missile to carry largest conventional warheadThe Defence Research and Development Organisation (DRDO) is developing a modified version of the Agni-5 intercontinental ballistic missile. The new variant will be a conventional weapon capable of carrying a massive 7500-kilogram bunker-buster warhead.

Who's the high command, if not Congress chief? BJP trolls Mallikarjun KhargeCongress president Mallikarjun Kharge told the media that the question of changing Karnataka Chief Minister can only be answered by the party high command. BJP MP Tejasvi Surya asks who exactly is this 'high command'.

Controversial BJP MLA T Raja Singh quits party amid Telangana leadership tussleBJP MLA from Goshamahal, T Raja Singh, resigned from the party amid a leadership tussle in Telangana. He said he remains committed to Hindutva and serving the people of Goshamahal. He appealed to PM Modi and senior BJP leaders to reconsider the state leadership.

How anti-Zionist Boom, Boom, Tel Aviv song set internet on fire'Boom, Boom Tel Aviv' is an anti-Zionist track by controversial American war veteran Lucas Gage written in response to Iran's missile strikes on Israel. It went viral worldwide with nearly 600 million views in under 24 hours. The song has been taken down from most platforms but keeps resurfacing.

China's Thousand Talents Plan: A weapon to win the tech raceIn the global race for tech supremacy, talent is the most valuable currency. And few countries have pursued it as aggressively or as strategically as China

Day 1 Live Updates: Medvedev, Ostapenko kick off proceedingsWimbledon 2025 Day 1 Live Updates: Daniil Medvedev and Jelena Ostapenko have started proceedings in the opening round. Later in the day, Carlos Alcaraz and Aryna Sabalenka will be in action.

MS Dhoni files for trademark of iconic nickname 'Captain Cool'Over the years, 'Captain Cool' has meant much more than just a catchy title. It sums up Dhoni's calm mind under pressure, from winning India's first T20 World Cup in 2007 to lifting the ODI World Cup in 2011 and the Champions Trophy in 2013.

To counter India, China, Pakistan and Bangladesh creating a Saarc-replacementChina, Pakistan and Bangladesh have formed a nexus and are trying to create a regional grouping to replace Saarc, which includes India as a member. The three plan to get other South Asian nations to become part of the grouping. Saarc activities came to a halt after India boycotted the summit in Pakistan over the Uri terror attack.
Is Mumbai's iconic Parsi cafe Jimmy Boy permanently closed?Jimmy Boy, the iconic joint, shut its doors just months before it was set to celebrate 100 years of serving Parsi culinary heritage.

Kolkata rape accused stalked survivor from first day of college, plot pre-plannedUpon investigation, the police found that the trio had recorded several instances of harassing women on their mobile phones, which they later used as ammunition to blackmail them. 'The trio had been plotting for several days to carry out this torture on the victim,' said police.

Bangladesh Hindu woman raped, beaten over Rs 35,000 family loan: ReportThe loan repayment date had passed, prompting Fazar Ali to visit the family. At that time, neither the survivor's brothers nor her parents were present. As she refused to answer the door, Fazar broke it open, stripped her naked, beat and raped her, according to the survivor and her brother's accounts.

Indians to benefit as Trump's Big Beautiful Bill reduces remittance tax to 1%US President Donald Trump's flagship One Big Beautiful Bill Act, which passed a key Senate hurdle, cut remittance tax to 1%, from the proposed 5%. The high rate sparked widespread concern among Indian professionals in the US. The reduced tax rate will be a big relief for them and the NRIs who send money home.

The anti-ageing trap: Inside the unregulated world of longevity medicationsActor Shefali Jariwala's sudden death has put a spotlight on the anti-ageing industry in India. Doctors warn about serious health risks while chasing popular but unregulated procedures.

Newlywed bride dies by suicide over dowry torture, had given Volvo car, 800 gm goldA 27-year-old newlywed woman died by suicide allegedly due to dowry-related harassment by her husband and in-laws. Police found her body in a parked car after she consumed pesticide.
Go back to Third World: US politician on Zohran Mamdani's eating with hands videoA video of Zohran Mamdani eating with his hands during an interview has sparked debate online.

Watch: Kalam Labs's UAV soars to edge of stratosphere in record flightThe latest mission saw a fully autonomous, sub-4 kg UAV — designed and built at Kalam Labs — navigate from a balmy +20°C at launch to a frigid -60°C at peak altitude.

Naseeruddin Shah backs Diljit, slams political attacks: He had no role in castingVeteran actor Naseeruddin Shah shared a post and backed Diljit Dosanjh amid the 'Sardaar Ji 3' controversy. The actor stated how such acts hamper personal interactions between Indians and Pakistanis.

Who is Ayush Shetty? India's 6ft 4in-tall badminton hope wins US OpenAyush Shetty clinched his first senior title at the US Open Super 300 tournament. His win signals a new era for Indian badminton with rising young talent making waves.

Old is gold: BJP elevates veterans in Telangana and AndhraIn Telangana, N Ramchander Rao, an old-timer in the state's BJP unit, returned to the spotlight. PVN Madhav, a second-generation BJP leader with strong ties to the RSS, replaced D Purandeswari in Andhra Pradesh.

Do billionaires have a right to exist? Zohran Mamdani's replyZohran Mamdani emphasised the need for greater equality across the city, state, and country while expressing willingness to work with all residents, including billionaires, to create a fairer society.
2025 Mercedes-AMG GT 63 4MATIC+ First LookWe got a chance to get up close with the new second-gen Mercedes-AMG GT, in its 63 avatar that can now be purchased in India

IIT Hyderabad, ISRO, India Post create Digipin, a digital address system for IndiaAiming to clean up India's chaotic address system, a team from IIT Hyderabad, along with India Post, and ISRO's National Remote Sensing Centre (NRSC) have developed Digipin, a GPS-based digital address system that converts every Indian location into a unique machine-readable, offline-compatible code.

Shefali Jariwala's death probe: Anti-ageing, skin glow medicines, fasting in focusShefali Jariwala was found dead at her residence on June 27. The police officials collected anti-ageing and skin-glow medicines from her place during their investigation.

Who gave him seat? BJP flags rape-accused student's low rank, targets TrinamoolMalviya alleged that Zaib Ahmed was admitted to South Calcutta Law College despite securing a "dismal" rank of 2634 in the Calcutta University Law Entrance Test.

sports.headline: Faf du Plessis scripts world record with second hundred after turning 40Faf du Plessis became the first T20 batter to score more then one hundred after turning 40. His stellar form helped Texas Super Kings defeat MI New York in a crunch Major League Cricket match in Dallas on Sunday, June 29.

Batting cage and tennis balls: Steve Smith fast tracks recovery before 2nd TestSteve Smith revealed that he trained in a New York baseball cage while recovering from his finger injury. Smith is in the running for a return in the 2nd Test match against West Indies.

RCB head coach joins Southern Brave for Hundred Women's 2025Southern Brave have roped in Luke Williams as their head coach and Marcus Trescothick as their batting coach for the 2025 edition of the Women's Premier League.

Who is Ayush Shetty? India's 6ft 4in-tall badminton hope wins US OpenAyush Shetty clinched his first senior title at the US Open Super 300 tournament. His win signals a new era for Indian badminton with rising young talent making waves.

Pakistan appoint former all-rounder as 'acting coach' for Test teamPakistan have appointed former all-rounder Azhar Mahmood as their acting red-ball head coach. Pakistan finished at the bottom in the 2023-25 edition of the World Test Championship.

Armed with English wisdom, Kuldeep makes bold promise ahead of Test comebackEngland vs India: Spinner Kuldeep Yadav recalled his experience of learning from Kevin Pietersen about the nuances of bowling in England. The wrist-spinner might make his way into the XI for the second Test, starting July 02 in Birmingham.

Can India make a comeback in Birmingham?  Here's what history suggestsENG vs IND: Shubman Gill's India are looking to make a comeback in the five-match Test series after losing the opening Test at Headingley in Leeds by five wickets.

Yashasvi Jaiswal eyes Rahul Dravid's historic 26-year-old recordENG vs IND: Yashasvi Jaiswal can become the fastest Indian to 2000 Test runs in the second Test starting July 2 at the Edgbaston in Birmingham.

A Bumrah surprise? AB de Villiers offers optimistic take on ENG vs IND Test seriesEngland vs India: Former South Africa captain AB de Villiers said India should have managed Jasprit Bumrah's workload better and had him ready to play all five Tests in the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy.

From Bublik to Medvedev: 5 men who can spring a surpriseAs 2025 has shown to be the year for first-timers, let us have a look at some of the dark horses that could put up a surprising challenge against the Big 3 for Wimbledon's men's singles title.

Can Kuldeep dismantle England? India's spin gamble against Bazball in BirminghamHaving lost the first Test despite dominating the majority of the match has left India questioning their team combination and on-field tactics. Could Kuldeep Yadav emerge as the knight in the shining armour to take down England's Bazball during the second Test at Edgbaston, Birmingham.

Day 1, Schedule and Live Streaming: Alcaraz, Sabalenka, Paolini in actionWimbledon 2025 Day 1: Carlos Alcaraz, Aryna Sabalenka and Jasmine Paolini are amongst the top names to be in action in their respective first round matches of the grass court major.

Carlos Alcaraz targets historic Wimbledon three-peat, chases place among legendsCarlos Alcaraz will begin his quest for a rare Wimbledon three-peat on Monday, aiming to join an exclusive club of legends when the 2025 Championships get underway at the All England Lawn Tennis and Croquet Club in London.

Steve Smith shares update on finger injury before Grenada TestWI vs AUS: After missing the first Test due to a finger injury, veteran batter Steve Smith sounded confident of making the cut for the second Test in Grenada.

Definitely not difficult: Krejcikova confident before title defenceWimbledon 2025: Barbora Krejcikova said that instead of taking the pressure of being the defending champion, she wants to enjoy the game when she steps out to face Alexandra Eala in the first round.

Sabalenka, Swiatek, Gauff: Who will finally tame the grass at Wimbledon?Wimbledon 2025: Eyes will be on Aryna Sabalenka, Coco Gauff and Iga Swiatek as they are set to take part in the grass-court major, which starts on Monday. Barbora Krejcikova, in the meantime, will be looking to defend her crown.

Lionel Messi cruelly denied revenge as PSG dominate Inter Miami 4-0Lionel Messi's quest for poetic closure ended in silence as Paris Saint-Germain, his former club, ruthlessly dismantled Inter Miami 4-0 in Atlanta's Mercedes-Benz Stadium, knocking them out of the 2025 Club World Cup.

ZIM vs SA 1st Test: South Africa gain control on Day 2 despite Williams' hundredSean Williams scored a fighting 137 to help Zimbabwe avoid follow-on in the first Test against South Africa. Despite his efforts, South Africa ended Day 2 with a strong lead, signalling a tough challenge for the hosts.

India were fantastic under Shubman Gill: England's Jamie SmithDespite India's defeat at Headingley, England batter Jamie Smith lauded Shubman Gill's captaincy and India's all-round effort, countering criticism about the team's inexperience and calling their performance "fantastic" across the four hard-fought days.

Austrian GP: Lando Norris leads McLaren domination, Ferrari snaps redemptionMcLaren stole the show at the Austrian Grand Prix with a dominant 1-2 finish, while Red Bull faced heartbreak on home turf as Verstappen crashed out early and Williams suffered a disastrous double DNF.

India continue impressive run in Women's Asian Cup qualifiers with Timor-Leste winThe Indian senior women's team delivered a commanding 4-0 win over Timor-Leste in the AFC Asian Cup qualifiers on Sunday, June 29. The victory strengthens their position on top of Group B.

Smriti Mandhana eyes more T20I success after maiden hundred: Still work in progressSmriti Mandhana said that her batting in T20Is is still a work in progress after scoring her maiden hundred in the format on June 28. Mandhana became the second Indian batter to score a T20I hundred.

ENG-W vs IND-W: England handed fine for slow over-rate in Trent Bridge T20IENG-W vs IND-W: England's rough start to the T20I series against India worsened after they were fined 10% of their match fees for a slow over-rate in their 97-run loss at Trent Bridge on June 28.

Give Shubman Gill a fair chance: Mohammed Azharuddin slams India captain criticsMohammed Azharuddin has jumped to the defence of Shubman Gill ,saying that the Indian Test team captain should be given a fair chance. Gill's captaincy has been criticised after India's loss in the Headingley Test.

Wimbledon looms for Djokovic: Final shot at glory or end of an era?Wimbledon 2025: Former World No.1 Novak Djokovic has had his fair share of struggles this year, but the Serb has plenty to look forward to when he begins his campaign in the grass-court major.

US not right place for Club World Cup: Chelsea boss Enzo Maresca on match stoppageEnzo Maresca was left fuming at the fact that Chelsea's game against Benfica in the Club World Cup was halted for almost two hours due to weather conditions in Charlotte. Maresca claimed that the US may not be the right place to host the tournament.

Shubman Gill texted me: How Harpreet Brar joined India nets in BirminghamHarpreet Brar joined India's nets in Birmingham after a personal invite from skipper Shubman Gill, sparking fresh buzz around spin tactics and bowling combinations ahead of the second Test against England at Edgbaston.

WI vs AUS: Steve Smith likely to play 2nd Test, reveals head coach Andrew McDonaldAustralia batter Steve Smith is likely to play in the second Test against the West Indies, revealed head coach Andrew McDonald. Smith missed the first Test after sustaining a finger injurey during the World Test Championship (WTC) final 2025 vs South Africa.

Will I ever play again? Pant's surgeon recalls rehab process after accidentRishabh Pant's surgeon recalled the Indian wicketkeeper's journey after his car accident in December 2022. Pant was out of the game for close to 16 months after the accident.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
